title: Jack Elwyn Evans
text:
John "Jack" Elwyn Evans (1897 – 15 July 1941) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Brynamman%20RFC">Brynamman RFC</a>, <a href="Amman%20United%20RFC">Amman United RFC</a>, <a href="Swansea%20RFC">Swansea RFC</a>, and <a href="Llanelli%20RFC">Llanelli RFC</a> as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a>, or <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Centre">centre</a>, i.e. number 11 or 14, or 12 or 13, and club level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a>.
Background.
Jack Elwyn Evans was born in <a href="Brynamman">Brynamman</a>, Wales, and he died aged 43–44 in <a href="Denbigh">Denbigh</a>, Wales.
International honours.
Jack Evans won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> (RU) while at Llanelli RFC in 1924 against Scotland.
